data.title: 15 years ago and Still just as Good today.
data.text: It was a favorite back then and it is still as tasty today as then. This is a great place to try Indian food if you are not sure if you have a guests who are shy. The staff is very nice,  willing to share their expertise and guide you through a great meal.

data.title: Under-rated - 5 Star Food and Service
data.text: We dine here regularly. The food equals that of the best London Indian restaurants. Authentic dishes are perfectly spiced, served piping hot with good size portions. The servers are consistently excellent.

data.title: Good Indian Lunch Buffet
data.text: This is our office's go to place for lunch. The food is quite good for a buffet. The flavors are pretty authentic. The naan, tandoori chicken, and veggie masala are really good. The chai is great and reminds me of India. The staff are friendly and clear your plate so you can grab some more food. The restaurant has a large central table that can easily accommodate large parties - we went with a group of a dozen or so. Paying at the counter separately makes it easy for an office lunch so we don't have to worry about splitting up the bill.

data.title: Food is Good, but the Place Needs Help
data.text:
We've dined there twice in the last year. The second time to give it another chance since we really like Indian food. Same experience: the place was nearly empty the first time and we were the ONLY party the second time. And the harsh lighting just makes the place seem cold, isolated and wanting.

The food is quite good, but they need to warm up the atmosphere and get some traffic in there so you don't feel like you're the only ones foolish enough to try the place.

data.title: Good Indian food, nice atmosphere
data.text:
Being mostly vegetarian, Indian food is one the default choices. India Cafe in Iowa City is quite good, not the best but certainly in my 70s percentile rank. Their Masala Chai is particularly good.
I like very much the atmosphere. Even when crowded, it's never too loud, and if you get a booth you get a good amount of privacy.
I have never tried dinner a la carte, only lunch buffet, so I cannot judge. But for a lunch buffet I'd definitively recommend.

data.title: Mediocre at best
data.text: We were not impressed.  Dining are was cold and had a cafeteria atmosphere. We ordered three entrees to share - all order medium spice level. One had not heat at all, one was medium, and the the third was almost too spicy to eat.  beyond the spice levels, the food was pretty basic. Even though the restaurant was almost empty (should have been a clue to dine elsewhere) the server was not attentive - 15 minutes before he came to check on our meals.  It appears that the lunch buffet is popular, but I could not recommend India Cafe in the evening.

data.title: Great Taste
data.text: I am a huge fan of Indian food. The the India Cafe is pretty good compared to others, but not my favorite. I had the lunch buffet, which was a decent price. The staff is friendly. I would recommend this to a person that enjoys Indian food.

data.title: Oh wow. First really good restaurant hole in the wall in birmingham  that I've found
data.text:
Great food, affordable, such courteous and friendly service!! Am only driving through here and so can experience this but once. I do know that if I am ever here again, this is the place I will visit :) 

Highly recommended: mango ice cream... Fresh, home made with actual mango pieces and pulp..... Yummmm

data.title: For downtown good but there is better
data.text: Perfectly adequate lunch buffet.  Excellent Nann.  The food on the buffet was fresh and well replensihed and a nice selection.

data.title: Can Still Savor the Goodness!
data.text:
This was the 2nd time going to the restaurant, and didn't write a review the 1st time 'cause at the point was starving & anything would've amazed me, but the last time, which was just about 2 weeks ago confirmed my 1st experience; AMAZING!

Before this restaurant had tried Indian food 2 times & they just didn't meet expectations that everyone was setting in my mind.  The restuarant before this, thinking it was on Debuque St close or next to Atlas had flavors that had me thinking that they were covering something up since there food was completely over-whelming with...I don't know...either the sauce that the food was drenched in or the spices didn't convince my taste buds; more or less paralyzed them, and had me tasting the curry all day long.....(Misala).

What I liked about this restaurant is that the food doesn't over-whelm your senses (smell, or taste), and is actually delightfully good looking.  There was this one red tinted chicken that was just...wow and it just slipped off the bone.  Would highly recommend this restaurant if I were asked for a different, exotic experience or if right off the bat was asked for Indian food.  Not to mention the price is great (only been there during their lunch buffet special).

data.title: Best Tandoori Chicken
data.text: Many of the reviews are for the lunch buffet, but with limited time, we went for dinner.  The samosas were cooked to perfection.  Our favorite was the tandoori chicken, perfectly cooked and seasoned.  Our waiter did ask us if we wanted our food mild, medium or hot.  All entrees were either perfectly medium or a little mild.  We also had the Chicken Tikka Masala and Lamb Curry.  They were excellent choices as well. Because we only had a limited amount of entrees, I thought what we did order was very authentic and made our college age daughter quite happy not to have to eat dorm food.  I would highly recommend coming for dinner.  Even with drinks, the bill was $59 for 3 people.

data.title: Lunch buffet is the best deal
data.text:
Even if you are an Indian food snob, you can't beat a nice varied buffet with fresh naan always being replenished, and all sauces and desserts available, with both vegetarian and meat options for only $8. And they leave a pitcher of ice water at every table, otherwise they serve you drinks. 
Dinner is still good in my opinion, just expect to select off a menu only (no buffet) and prices per dish are higher and don't all include naan or dessert or sauces. 
Service is average, sometimes really good sometimes slow, just like anywhere else. The only annoying thing is they do that "closed for a few awkward hours between lunch and dinner," so if you have an abnormal schedule or get hungry early or late like I do, they may not be open.

data.title: Like going to India
data.text: Authentic Indian food.  Try the samosas(knish).  Their tandoori grill is very good.  A bit pricey by Iowa standards.  Great lunch buffet is a cheaper option, with 11:30a-2:30p hrs.  Tandoori chicken and three other choices.  Locals pack in there at lunchtime.

data.title: Each visit a little less satisfying . . .
data.text: I've eaten at India Cafe for many years, ever since it opened and offered the first tandoori chicken in town (Masala, the other downtown Indian restaurant a couple of blocks away, is vegetarian).  As a tandoori fan, I became a regular, but what little charm there was in this restaurant faded a bit with each repeat visit.  The place is dark, has a funky smell, and usually is overseen by a single waiter who disappears for long periods into the kitchen (I've sometimes wondered if he's also the cook).  Some nights the place can be eerily empty, though other times it seems fairly full.  I've had a sense of slow decline, and the food I was once excited to have now seems just okay.

data.title: Lunch buffet
data.text: Reliable and price is right, but not especially exciting.  Each dish tastes like the next. The staff is reliable on water refills. Friendly and quick.

data.title: U. of Iowa - Liberal Arts Only??
data.text:
University can't have a Computer Science Department or a School of Engineering that's worth anything if this passes for Indian food in town!

Cleavered chicken in saag?  Goat chunks okay, but not bones that want to splinter.

Narrow, NY Deli length space with no life and no charm.  

Staff reserved....to the point of zombiehood.

Pass.

data.title: rude management but YUMMY  buffet
data.text: WE don't love the management, but it's the best indian downtown iowa city.

data.title: Lunch buffet is decent
data.text:
My family and I have visited this restaurant several times over the past 11 years.  Their lunch buffet has the usual North Indian dishes:  naan, tandoori chicken, basmati rice, dals, lamb, saag paneer, gulab jamun, etc.  We usually only go there for the lunch buffet but I've heard their menu items are good too.  

Parking can be difficult to find on weekends.  The service is pretty basic, but then we don't go there for that, but for the tasty food.  

Prices are reasonably cheap.

data.title: Buffet can't be beat
data.text: If you like Indian food, you do not want to miss this buffet.  Consistently great Indian food.  Great paneer, great tamarind chutney, great veg dishes.

data.title: Good food/reasonable price.
data.text: Good buffet with a nice selection for a reasonable price
